meanings.definition: A level strip of land on which aircraft can take off and land.
meanings.sent1: The small plane landed smoothly on the airstrips.
meanings.sent2: The military base had multiple airstrips for different aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The cows thought the airstrips were long, narrow pastures for them to graze on.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an airstrip, always ready for new ideas to take off.
meanings.sent5: The airstrips stretched out like welcoming arms for the incoming planes.

meanings.sent1: The construction crew will airstrip the field for the airshow.
meanings.sent2: They decided to airstrip the remote island for emergency medical evacuations.
meanings.sent3: The kids wanted to airstrip their backyard for their toy planes to land.
meanings.sent4: She wished she could airstrip her mind to make it easier for thoughts to land.
meanings.sent5: The team worked hard to airstrip the area before the storm hit.
